mys.title: Manage Your Server
mys.dontDisplayCaption: <u style="ACCELERATOR:true">D</u>on't display this page at logon

linkerror.text: Windows cannot find the file or page you requested (%1). Press F5 to refresh the Manage Your Server page, and then click the link again.

task.title: You do not have the correct permissions to manage this server.
task.description: You do not have the correct permissions to manage this server. For more information, contact your system administrator.

task.title: Managing Your Server is not available for this operating system.
task.description: Manage Your Server is available only for the following operating systems: Windows Server 2003, Standard Edition; Windows Server 2003, Enterprise Edition; Windows Server 2003, Datacenter Edition.

task.title: Cluster Nodes Cannot Be Managed with Manage Your Server
task.description: Because this server is a member of a server cluster (also called a cluster node), you cannot manage it with Manage Your Server. For information about managing a cluster node, click Read about managing cluster nodes.

subtask.name: Read about managing cluster nodes
subtask.tooltip: Runs the Configure Your Server Wizard.

task.title: Adding Roles to Your Server
task.description: Adding roles to your server lets it perform specific tasks. For example, the file server role enables your server to share files. To add a role, start the Configure Your Server Wizard by clicking Add or remove a role.

subtask.name: Add or remove a role
subtask.tooltip: Runs the Configure Your Server Wizard.

subtask.name: Read about server roles
subtask.tooltip: Opens a document that helps you determine which roles to select for your server.

task.title: Managing Your Server Roles
task.nodatadescription: After you have added a role, return to this page at any time for tools and information to help you with your daily administrative tasks.
task.nodata: No roles have been added to this server. To add a role, click Add or remove a role.
task.roledescription: Your server has been configured with the following roles:
task.description: Use the tools and information found here to add or remove roles and perform your daily administrative tasks.

subtask.name: Add or remove a role
subtask.tooltip: Runs the Configure Your Server Wizard.

subtask.name: Read about server roles
subtask.tooltip: Opens a document that helps you determine which roles to select for your server.

subtask.name: Read about remote administration
subtask.tooltip: Provides information about allowing remote access to this computer.

tool.name: Administrative Tools
tool.tooltip: Provides tools that help you manage computers, services, and resources on your network.

tool.name: More Tools
tool.tooltip: Opens the Tools page in Help and Support Center.

tool.name: Windows Update
tool.tooltip: Connects you to the Windows Update Web site, where you can search for the latest updates, security fixes, and device drivers.

tool.name: Computer and Domain Name Information
tool.tooltip: Displays the Computer Name tab in System properties, where you can change this server's computer name or domain membership.

tool.name: Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration
tool.tooltip: Opens a Help topic about the Internet Explorer Enhanced Security Configuration tool.

tool.name: Server Management
tool.tooltip: Opens the Server Management console, which helps you perform tasks associated with the roles you selected.

tool.name: Help and Support
tool.tooltip: Opens Help and Support Center, where you can find Help topics, troubleshooting information, and support services.

tool.name: Microsoft TechNet
tool.tooltip: Connects you to the TechNet Web site, which provides news and information for IT administration.

tool.name: Deployment and Resource Kits
tool.tooltip: Opens a Help topic that provides information about the Windows Deployment and Resource Kits and provides a link to this content on the Web.

tool.name: List of Common Administrative Tasks
tool.tooltip: Displays a list of the recommended daily maintenance tasks.

tool.name: Windows Server Communities
tool.tooltip: Connects you to the Microsoft Communities Web site, where you can communicate with peers and experts about deploying, managing, and troubleshooting Windows server operating systems.

tool.name: What's New
tool.tooltip: Provides details about new features and improvements in Windows Server 2003.

tool.name: Strategic Technology Protection Program
tool.tooltip: Connects you to the Microsoft TechNet Security Web site, which provides information and tools that help you make your server more secure.
